name: Metoprolol Tartrate

ingredients.name: SODIUM STARCH GLYCOLATE TYPE A POTATO

indications: metoprolol tartrate tablets beta-adrenergic blocker indicated treatment : hypertension , lower blood pressure . lowering blood pressure reduces risk fatal non-fatal cardiovascular events , primarily strokes myocardial infarctions . ( 1.1 ) angina pectoris . ( 1.2 ) myocardial infarction , reduce risk cardiovascular mortality used conjunction intravenous metoprolol therapy patients definite suspected acute myocardial infarction hemodynamically stable patients . ( 1.3 )
contraindications: administer daily food meal . titrate weekly longer intervals needed tolerated . ( 2 ) hypertension : recommended starting 100 mg daily , single divided doses . ( 2.1 ) angina pectoris : recommended starting 100 mg daily , given two divided doses . ( 2.2 ) myocardial infarction : starting depends upon tolerance intravenous metoprolol , full prescribing information . ( 2.3 )
warningsAndPrecautions: metoprolol tartrate tablets , usp available follows : tablets 25 mg white round shaped , film coated tablets debossed ‘ c 73 ’ one side deep break line side . ndc : 70518-3291-00 ndc : 70518-3291-01 ndc : 70518-3291-02 packaging : 60 1 blister pack packaging : 30 1 blister pack packaging : 30 1 blister pack store 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) ; excursions permitted 15° 30°c ( 59° 86°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . protect moisture heat . dispense tight , light-resistant container defined usp using child-resistant closure . repackaged distributed : remedy repack , inc. 625 kolter dr. suite # 4 indiana , pa 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions: metoprolol tartrate tablets contraindicated severe bradycardia , second- third-degree heart block , cardiogenic shock , systolic blood pressure < 100 , decompensated heart failure , sick sinus syndrome ( unless permanent pacemaker place ) , patients hypersensitive component product .
indications_original: Metoprolol tartrate tablets are a beta-adrenergic blocker indicated for the treatment of: Hypertension, to lower blood pressure. Lowering blood pressure reduces the risk of fatal and non-fatal cardiovascular events, primarily strokes and myocardial infarctions. ( 1.1 ) Angina Pectoris. ( 1.2 ) Myocardial Infarction, to reduce the risk of cardiovascular mortality when used in conjunction with intravenous metoprolol therapy in patients with definite or suspected acute myocardial infarction in hemodynamically stable patients. ( 1.3 )
contraindications_original: Administer once daily with food or after a meal. Titrate at weekly or longer intervals as needed and tolerated. ( 2 ) Hypertension: Recommended starting dosage is 100 mg daily, in single or divided doses. ( 2.1 ) Angina Pectoris: Recommended starting dosage is 100 mg daily, given as two divided doses. ( 2.2 ) Myocardial Infarction: The starting dosage depends upon tolerance of intravenous metoprolol, see full prescribing information. ( 2.3 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Metoprolol Tartrate Tablets, USP are available as follows:
                  Tablets 25 mg are white round shaped, film coated tablets debossed with ‘C over 73’ on one side and deep break line on other side.
                  
                  NDC: 70518-3291-00
                  NDC: 70518-3291-01
                  NDC: 70518-3291-02
                  PACKAGING: 60 in 1 BLISTER PACK
                  PACKAGING: 30 in 1 BLISTER PACK
                  PACKAGING: 30 in 1 BLISTER PACK
                  
                  Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F); excursions permitted to 15° to 30°C (59° to 86°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature].
                  
                  Protect from moisture and heat.
                  Dispense in a tight, light-resistant container as defined in the USP using a child-resistant closure.
                  
                  Repackaged and Distributed By:
                  Remedy Repack, Inc.
                  625 Kolter Dr. Suite #4 Indiana, PA 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions_original: Metoprolol tartrate tablets are contraindicated in severe bradycardia, second- or third-degree heart block, cardiogenic shock, systolic blood pressure <100, decompensated heart failure, sick sinus syndrome (unless a permanent pacemaker is in place), and in patients who are hypersensitive to any component of this product.
